definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: The juggler conjured a rabbit out of his hat.
sentences.chinese: 那變魔術的人從帽子裏變出一隻兔子。

sentences.english: Her grandfather taught her to conjure.
Talk like magic, make people difficult to distinguish true or false.
sentences.chinese: 說話像變魔術，真真假假讓人難分辨。

sentences.english: Out of that the ratio worked like magic.
sentences.chinese: 這個比例，像變魔術一樣。

sentences.english: While the process may look magical, the secret lies in a smartly designed gravity-based system.
sentences.chinese: 整個過程就像是在變魔術。

sentences.english: It may still seem like all of this synchronization is performed with smoke and mirrors.
sentences.chinese: 整個同步執行過程仍可能好像是在變魔術一樣虛幻。

sentences.english: When I'm not programming, I perform magic.
sentences.chinese: 我不寫程序的時候，喜歡變魔術。

sentences.english: Long-distance bitter brigade , I perform magic teasing a boy playing.
sentences.chinese: 長途苦旅，我變魔術逗男孩玩耍。

sentences.english: To relieve the monotony of the long journey, I played magic to entertain the boy.
sentences.chinese: 長途苦旅，我變魔術逗男孩玩耍。

sentences.english: Do you know how to do the magic?
Edwin:I am allergic to pollen and I hate magic.
sentences.chinese: 我對花粉過敏，我也討厭變魔術。

sentences.english: Drums started to pound, and the screens turned on as if by magic.
sentences.chinese: 緊接着鼓聲震天，那些熒幕像變魔術般亮了起來。

sentences.english: However, the food does not get into the machines by magic.
sentences.chinese: 但是，食品不可能像變魔術一樣進入機器。

sentences.english: You never understood... why we did this.
sentences.chinese: 你不懂我們爲什麼要變魔術？

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
variant of 附會|附会[fu4 hui4]
see 眾星捧月|众星捧月[zhong4 xing1 peng3 yue4]
from the inside to the outside/through and through/thoroughly
lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
